data.title: Lauren Holly, Jim Carrey’s Wife Bio, Measurements, Age, Net worth

data.text:
Lauren Holly is an accomplished Hollywood actress. Although her career was largely limited to small roles in major productions and starring roles in small indie productions, she still managed to amass an impressive filmography. She has also endeared herself to fans with some memorable characters, including director Jenny Shepherd on the long-running TV series NCIS. Find out more about Holly here, including her age, body measurements and love life.

Lauren Holly Bio (Age)

Lauren Michael Holly was born on the 28th of October 1963 in Bristol, Pennsylvania. She comes from a family of distinguished scholars; Her father, Grant Holly, is a professor of literature while her mother, Michael Ann Holly, is also a professor at the college. Holly’s family background is not limited to her parents. She also has two brothers named Nick and Alexander.

Lauren Holly grew up in New York and attendedGeneva High School, graduating in 1981. She also attended Sarah Lawrence College (New York) where she majored in English and graduated in 1985. Lauren Holly fell in love with acting when she was a child. This was due to the influence of her great-grandmother, who was a stage actress in London and Liverpool. Encouraging her love of art, Holly studied flute and theater at the London Academy of Music and Performing Arts.

Lauren Holly began her Hollywood career in 1984. Her debut role was in two episodes of the TV show Hill Street Blues. She then appeared in television series such as All My Children (1986), My Two Fathers (1990), Spenser: For Rent (1986), Love Lives On (1985) and The Antagonists (1991).

She also received roles in several films including Seven Minutes in Heaven (1986), Bond of the Hand (1986), The Adventures of Ford Fairlane (1990) and Live Wire (1992). The Bristol native got a well-deserved big break in the 1992 crime drama Picket Fences . In the series, she played the role of Deputy Sheriff Maxine Stewart and appeared in 87 episodes of the series. Picket Fences ran from 1992 to 1996 and Holly received two SAG nominations for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Drama Series.
